intro: Triumfetta suborbiculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf spurred carpetweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, orbiculate leaves and distinctive spurred petals on its yellow flowers. It typically grows in open, sunny areas and is often found in disturbed soils. Triumfetta suborbiculata is an herbaceous annual that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
